attributes.action: Force MP's to honour democratic referendum results voted by their constituents.
attributes.additional_details:
No matter whether you support Brexit or Remain, the people of Britain believe in democracy. 

The last time a government went against the people was Margaret Thatchers Poll Tax, and then there were the miners' strikes. MPs are underestimating the backlash and fear that those situations caused.
attributes.background:
Our country is at risk of widespread anarchy if democracy is ignored over Brexit. The country will be torn apart, voters will move further to the right or left, which is dangerous and unacceptable in modern Britain.

MPs should back democracy or resign.

rejection.details:
How an MP votes would be an individual decision for that person, and not a decision for the Government or Parliament as a whole.

You could ask your own MP to vote according to the result of referendum in your constituency. You can find out who your MP is and how to contact them here: 

https://www.parliament.uk/mps-lords-and-offices/mps/
